name: Proj MyPHD
description: This is a project specific External Module for MyPhD.  MyPHD is a personal health dashboard powered by researcher at Stanford.  More information can be found here: https://myphd.stanford.edu/.  This module enabled the distribution of base64 secure tokens as part of the application signup process.

project-settings.name: Define 1 or more claim events for your project

sub_settings.name:
Attempt Claim Logic
If this statement evaluates as TRUE on a Save event in THIS project, the defined claim below will be executed. Typically, you will use the Inbound Mapping Rules below to change the value of one of the fields referenced in this logic to prevent a record from re-claiming over and over on each save event. The logic is evaluated in the context of the current save event for event ids and instance ids.
e.g. [calc_do_lookup] = '1' AND [inbound_mapped_field] = ''

MyPHD Token Database Project
This is the project that has records 'to be claimed'. It must be classical. Check out the README for example project definitions.

External Lookup Logic
To find an available record from the EXTERNAL database, each external record will be evaluated using logic defined here until true. The syntax is a little different to accommodate a mix of THIS and the EXTERNAL project's data. For fields in the EXTERNAL project, use { } brackets instead of [ ] brackets. You can refer to data from the current record in THIS project using normal branching and also use smart variables.
Examples:
  • {claimed_date}='' will find the first external record without a claimed_date value.
  • {claimed_date}='' and {dag} = '[record-dag-name]' will find an EXTERNAL record where the column 'dag' has a value of the current record's unique group name
Check out the full documentation for more details and pay attention to quotes.

External Claimed By Field
(highly recommended) Field in the EXTERNAL project where this module will store the THIS project's record id when a claim occurs. Often this is the field referenced above in the External Lookup Logic
e.g. claimed_by -- just the field name, no brackets or braces.

External Date Claimed Field
(optional) Store timestamp of when the EXTERNAL record was claimed
e.g. claimed_date -- must be text or datetime field type
MyPHD Key Field name in EXTERNAL KEY project

Token Count Threshold
(optional) When the count of available tokens fall below this amount, an alert will be sent to the email entered in Error Email

OPTIONALLY: You can copy values from the key database project record to fields in THIS project when a claim event occurs. Make sure the field types are compatible. Note it IS possible to copy FILES as well as text values. Example fields you might want to copy are: key_base64 (text field), key (file field), claimed_timestamp (date field Y-M-D h:i:s)
MyPHD Key Field name in EXTERNAL KEY project
Field name in THIS project

Event in THIS project
Leave blank for current event

Instance in THIS project
Leave blank for current instance

Disable This Instance
So you can debug without having to delete all your configuration, you can simply check this box to prevent this instance of ProjMyPHD from evaluating on save.

project-settings.name:
Error Email
(optional) In the event there is a configuration error or processing error, enter an email address to be notified.
This email will be notified when token count is below threshold.

system-settings.name: Enable Debug Logging (system-wide)(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger
